hero.title: Hi! I'm Aziz
hero.description: I am a fourth-year Software Engineering student at Polytechnique Montréal with a strong interest in cloud computing, artificial intelligence, and applied mathematics. I previously worked as a web developer at PolyOrbite, a technical society, where I contributed to the development and maintenance of the organization’s website. More recently, I completed a software engineering internship at Poslik, a company providing point-of-sale (POS) solutions for restaurants. During this internship, I contributed to the development of an inventory management module by analyzing functional requirements, designing the technical architecture, and implementing core features such as quantity tracking, stock comparison, and automated adjustments. Working with PHP, Symfony, and PostgreSQL, I helped improve consistency between physical and digital inventories and streamline operational workflows. I am particularly motivated by projects that combine system design, cloud infrastructure, and data-driven solutions, and I enjoy building scalable, well-structured software systems.

skills.title: Skills
skills.math_desc: BFS, DFS, Dijkstra, A*; Machine Learning and Natural Language Processing; Calculus, Linear Algebra, Probability and Statistics, Optimization.
skills.other_desc: Data Analysis, CI/CD, Agile Development, Software Design, Operating Systems Kernels, Data Structures and Algorithms, Computer Networks, Docker and Virtualization, Databases (pgAdmin, Firebase, MongoDB), Linux development environment.

projects.title: My Projects
projects.rpg_stack: Electron, Angular, TypeScript, NestJS, MongoDB, AWS, Flutter, Dart, Firebase
projects.rpg_desc1: Developed a cross-platform multiplayer RPG platform with a desktop client (Electron) and a tablet mobile client connected to a shared backend
projects.rpg_desc2: Implemented real-time client–server features (chat notifications, channel management, member permissions) using a NestJS backend and scalable microservices architecture
projects.rpg_desc3: Led system design and architecture documentation (UML, system diagrams), contributed to CI/CD pipelines, and performed code reviews in an Agile team of 6
projects.skin_desc1: Developed a convolutional neural network for skin lesion risk classification, achieving strong validation performance and focusing on real-world image robustness (87% F1 accuracy).
projects.skin_desc2: Integrated the model into a mobile application with on-device inference, camera input, and user guidance, emphasizing privacy, usability, and ethical constraints (non-diagnostic use).
